articles.title: ‘Moore’s Law’s dead,’ Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says in justifying gaming-card price hike
articles.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated that "Moore's Law is dead" as he defended the price hike for the company's next-generation gaming cards, Ada Lovelace. He explained that silicon wafers are significantly more expensive to produce. Despite a softening in consumer demand, Huang anticipates a strong Q4 for Ada, citing high demand for their new chips.

articles.title: Nvidia CEO sees 'large space' for China sales despite U.S. restrictions
articles.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated that he still sees a large market for Nvidia's data center chips in China, despite U.S. export restrictions on two of its top chips (A100 and H100). Huang noted that the restrictions have specific performance thresholds that leave a "large space" for Nvidia's other products in the Chinese market, as the majority of their customers are not affected. He also indicated that Nvidia would seek licenses from the U.S. government for Chinese customers desiring the restricted high-end chips.

articles.title: Nvidia’s new AI-focused chip produces more realistic images in games
articles.summary: Nvidia Corp. has unveiled its new AI-focused graphics chip, the RTX 4090, which is designed to produce more realistic images in games by combining AI with traditional pixel calculations. The high-end chip, costing US$1,599, features 76 billion transistors and 24GB of memory, and will go on sale October 12, with other versions following in November. This launch aims to give customers a reason to upgrade amidst a slowdown in PC component demand.

articles.title: NVIDIA Delivers Quantum Leap in Performance, Introduces New Era of Neural Rendering With GeForce RTX 40 Series
articles.summary: NVIDIA unveiled its new GeForce RTX 40 Series GPUs, powered by the Ada Lovelace architecture and new DLSS 3 technology, promising up to 4x performance improvement for gamers and creators. The flagship RTX 4090 and two configurations of the RTX 4080 were introduced, alongside new features like neural rendering and RTX Remix for classic games. These advancements aim to redefine real-time ray tracing, AI-powered graphics, and creative workflows.

articles.title: NVIDIA Unveils DRIVE Thor — Centralized Car Computer Unifying Cluster, Infotainment, Automated Driving, and Parking in a Single, Cost-Saving System
articles.summary: NVIDIA announced DRIVE Thor, its next-generation centralized computer for autonomous vehicles, delivering up to 2,000 teraflops of performance. This superchip unifies intelligent functions like automated driving, parking, and infotainment into a single architecture, significantly reducing system cost and complexity. ZEEKR, a Geely-owned automaker, is the first customer, planning to integrate DRIVE Thor into its intelligent electric vehicles starting in early 2025.

articles.title: Nvidia founder says country major growth market
articles.summary: Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia Corp, stated that China remains a significant growth market despite US restrictions on high-end AI chip exports like the A100 and H100. Experts note that China's large market is crucial for semiconductor companies. The restrictions are expected to accelerate the development of domestic AI chip companies in China as they seek alternatives and build their own ecosystems.

articles.title: Chipmaker Nvidia launches new system for autonomous driving
articles.summary: Nvidia unveiled its new DRIVE Thor computing platform designed to centralize autonomous and assisted driving functions, as well as in-car entertainment. This system is intended to replace multiple chips and cables, lowering overall system costs. China's Geely-owned ZEEKR is the first announced customer for DRIVE Thor, though the announcement comes amidst U.S. export restrictions on some Nvidia chips to China.

articles.title: No Hang Ups With Hangul: KT Trains Smart Speakers, Customer Call Centers With NVIDIA AI
articles.summary: South Korea's leading mobile operator, KT, is leveraging NVIDIA AI to enhance its smart speaker, GiGA Genie, and its AI Contact Center (AICC). By building billion-parameter large language models trained with the NVIDIA DGX SuperPOD platform and NeMo framework, KT has significantly improved language understanding and conversational skills in the complex Korean language, as well as reduced consultation times in their customer service platform. This advancement allows GiGA Genie to offer more human-like interactions and AICC to efficiently manage over 100,000 calls daily.

articles.title: MicroVision's Lidar Solution Supported on NVIDIA DRIVE Autonomous Vehicle Platform
articles.summary: MicroVision announced that its MAVIN DR lidar system is now supported on the NVIDIA DRIVE AGX platform, enabling true highway-pilot functionality for OEMs. This integration aims to accelerate the adoption of advanced safety features in vehicles by providing high-resolution sensor technology with low latency. The MAVIN DR system is also supported on the NVIDIA DRIVE Sim simulation platform for development and validation.

articles.title: Supermicro Delivers Second-Generation NVIDIA® OVX™ Computing System for 3D Collaboration, Metaverse, and Digital Twin Simulation, Powered by the New NVIDIA L40 GPU
articles.summary: Supermicro announced the release of its second-generation NVIDIA OVX computing system, powered by the new NVIDIA L40 GPU, designed for 3D collaboration, metaverse, and digital twin simulation. These new servers aim to provide the necessary graphics, AI, and network performance for building and operating immersive 3D virtual worlds at data center scale. The systems will support up to eight NVIDIA L40 GPUs, ConnectX-7 SmartNICs, and current/future CPU processors from Intel and AMD.

articles.title: Supermicro Announces 8U H100 HGX Server
articles.summary: Supermicro has announced its new 8U Universal GPU Server, incorporating eight NVIDIA H100 Tensor Core GPUs, designed for large-scale AI training, NVIDIA Omniverse, and Metaverse applications. This server increases AI performance with improved thermal density, enabling lower power consumption and operation at higher data center temperatures, while supporting both current and next-generation CPUs and GPUs. The company is expanding its leading GPU server lineup with this addition, offering flexibility with front and rear I/O, AC or DC power support, and liquid cooling options.

articles.title: Shaping Kroger’s Self-Checkout of Tomorrow with AI and Edge Computing
articles.summary: Kroger is enhancing its self-checkout experience and reducing stock losses by implementing Everseen’s Visual AI platform, powered by Lenovo’s AI retail solutions and NVIDIA Accelerated Computing AI Platform. This technology utilizes Edge AI servers and high-resolution cameras to detect and correct scanning errors, providing real-time insights and improving inventory management. The solution has been successfully piloted and is being rolled out across Kroger's stores, significantly reducing retail shrink and improving customer experience without extensive associate intervention.

articles.title: Rigetti Announces New Partnerships and Details Multi-Year Roadmap Designed to Reach Quantum Advantage
articles.summary: Rigetti Computing, Inc. announced an updated multi-year roadmap and key partnerships at its inaugural investor day, focusing on achieving Quantum Advantage. The roadmap includes the upcoming Ankaa™ 84-qubit system and Lyra™ 336-qubit system, alongside collaborations with companies like Keysight, NVIDIA, Bluefors, and Microsoft Azure to enhance hardware, software, and climate modeling applications. Rigetti is also expanding its Fab-1 facility and developing next-generation cryogenic platforms.

articles.title: Company created by two South Africans tops S&P 500 30-year performance
articles.summary: Monster Beverage Corporation, co-founded by two South African WITS graduates, has ranked as the top-performing stock in the S&P 500 over the last 30 years, achieving a staggering 213,088% total return. The company, initially Hansen Natural Corporation, was acquired in 1990 by Rodney Sacks and Hilton Schlosberg and saw significant growth after launching Monster Energy in 2002. This success story highlights the remarkable financial performance of the energy drink giant, even outperforming tech titans like Amazon, Apple, and Nvidia.

articles.title: Kodiak Robotics relies on lightweight mapping for autonomous truck PNT
articles.summary: Kodiak Robotics is developing autonomous truck technology for long-haul routes, focusing on a "lightweight mapping" approach that prioritizes reliability over high-definition mapping. The company has announced partnerships with Pilot Company and others to expand its service footprint, integrate its fourth-generation autonomous truck technology, and address the critical need for robust PNT solutions. Kodiak aims to integrate its self-driving software and hardware into production customer trucks by early 2025.

articles.title: Direxion Semiconductor (SOXL) Stock Is Down 83%. What’s Next?
articles.summary: The Direxion Daily Semiconductor Bull 3X Shares (SOXL) ETF has plummeted 83% this year, exhibiting a head and shoulders pattern, which typically signals further losses. Despite this, the ETF has reached a significant support level, potentially setting the stage for a rally. However, investors are cautioned about the risks associated with leveraged ETFs like SOXL, which aim for a 3X daily return of the ICE Semiconductor Index and can amplify both gains and losses.

articles.title: Nvidia Corporation (NASDAQ: NVDA) Company Profile
articles.summary: This Coresight Research report provides a company profile of Nvidia Corporation (NASDAQ: NVDA). It covers key aspects such as countries of operation, product categories, annual metrics like revenues and operating margin, business strategy, and recent developments. The report is part of the "Tech 20" series, focusing on companies providing enabling technology for retail.
